intro: Gayophytum diffusum var. strictipes, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed gayophytum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
